ground_truth: The owl takes wing and swoops low along the misty road. As it glides silently away through the trees, an upright elderly gentleman appears out of the shadows. He has a flowing white beard and long, silky white hair, and wears a pointed black hat. A plump tabby cat sitting on a wall turns its head curiously. The old gentleman walks along the pavement and stops beneath a street light. In his hand, he holds a small metal object which he flicks open. He raises the metal object and points it at a street lamp. The light from the lamp flies towards his hand and the lamp goes out. The light from the second street lamp disappears, and then a third. When all the lights in the road have been extinguished, the old gentleman lowers the metal object and flicks it shut. He looks over the top of his half-moon glasses at the plump tabby cat. The cat gives a hiccup, and its shadow looms large against the wall. It turns into a stern-looking woman wearing a cloak and a tall pointed black hat with a large brim. A bright light appears in the sky above the treetops, the lights of a motorcycle. Coattails flying, Hagrid, a huge giant, zooms down and screeches to a halt. Twinkling eyes peer out below dark bushy eyebrows. He has a huge black beard. He hands over a small bundle wrapped in a warm blanket. As Professor Dumbledore gently places the bundle on a doorstep, a tear runs down Hagrid's cheek. The tiny baby has a jacket scar on his forehead. A boy with a jacket scar on his forehead lies fast asleep. In the cupboard under the stairs, Harry Potter wakes and puts on a pair of large round spectacles mended with sticky tape. A pudgy boy crashes down the stairs. A shadow of dust falls on Harry. The pudgy boy rushes into the kitchen. Harry comes in. Dudley stares at the huge pile of birthday presents. Dudley and his mother get into the car with a big bag of sweets. Uncle Vernon wags his car key in Harry's face. In the Reptile House at the zoo, Dudley stares at the sleeping python. Vernon bangs on the glass. Harry looks at the snake sympathetically. The python lifts its head and winks. It flicks its tongue and nods. It shakes its head. Dudley knocks Harry aside. Suddenly, the glass partition disappears. Dudley tumbles over the rail. He falls headfirst into the pond inside the snake's enclosure. Dudley sits spluttering in the pond, as the snake slithers over the wooden rail and down onto the floor beside Harry. The python raises its head and stares straight at him.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: The bird takes flight and dives low along the foggy path. As it sails quietly away through the woods, an upright elderly man emerges out of the shadows. He has a flowing white beard and long, silky white hair, and wears a pointed black hat. A plump tiger-striped cat sitting on a barrier turns its head curiously. The old man strides along the sidewalk and pauses beneath a street lamp. In his hand, he holds a small metallic device which he flicks open. He lifts the metallic device and aims it at a street lamp. The illumination from the lamp flies towards his hand and the lamp goes out. The illumination from the second street lamp vanishes, and then a third. When all the lights in the path have been extinguished, the old man lowers the metallic device and flicks it shut. He gazes over the top of his half-moon spectacles at the plump tiger-striped cat. The cat gives a hiccup, and its shadow looms large against the barrier. It transforms into a stern-looking woman wearing a cloak and a tall pointed black hat with a large brim. A bright illumination appears in the sky above the treetops, the lights of a motorcycle. Coattails flying, Hagrid, a huge giant, zooms down and screeches to a halt. Twinkling eyes peer out below dark bushy eyebrows. He has a huge black beard. He hands over a small bundle wrapped in a warm blanket. As Professor Dumbledore gently sets the bundle on a doorstep, a tear runs down Hagrid's cheek. The tiny infant has a jacket scar on his forehead. A boy with a jacket scar on his forehead lies fast asleep. In the cupboard under the staircase, Harry Potter wakes and puts on a pair of large round spectacles mended with adhesive tape. A pudgy boy crashes down the staircase. A shadow of dust falls on Harry. The pudgy boy rushes into the kitchen. Harry enters. Dudley stares at the huge heap of birthday gifts. Dudley and his mother get into the vehicle with a big sack of candies. Uncle Vernon wags his car key in Harry's face. In the Reptile House at the zoo, Dudley stares at the sleeping snake. Vernon bangs on the glass. Harry looks at the serpent sympathetically. The snake lifts its head and winks. It flicks its tongue and nods. It shakes its head. Dudley knocks Harry aside. Suddenly, the glass partition vanishes. Dudley tumbles over the rail. He falls headfirst into the pond inside the snake's habitat. Dudley sits spluttering in the pond, as the snake slithers over the wooden rail and down onto the floor beside Harry. The snake raises its head and stares directly at him.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The wing is taken by the owl and it is swooped low along the misty road. As it is glided silently away through the trees, an upright elderly gentleman is made to appear out of the shadows. A flowing white beard and long, silky white hair are had by him, and a pointed black hat is worn. A plump tabby cat, which is sitting on a wall, turns its head curiously. The pavement is walked along by the old gentleman and he is made to stop beneath a street light. In his hand, a small metal object is held, which is flicked open by him. The metal object is raised by him and it is pointed at a street lamp. The light from the lamp is flown towards his hand and the lamp is made to go out. The light from the second street lamp disappears, and then a third. When the lights in the road have been extinguished, the metal object is lowered by the old gentleman and it is flicked shut. Over the top of his half-moon glasses, the plump tabby cat is looked at by him. A hiccup is given by the cat, and its shadow is loomed large against the wall. It is turned into a stern-looking woman wearing a cloak and a tall pointed black hat with a large brim. In the sky above the treetops, a bright light appears, the lights of a motorcycle. Coattails flying, a huge giant, Hagrid, zooms down and a halt is screeched to. Below dark bushy eyebrows, twinkling eyes peer out. A huge black beard is had by him. A small bundle wrapped in a warm blanket is handed over by him. As the bundle is gently placed on a doorstep by Professor Dumbledore, a tear is run down Hagrid's cheek. On his forehead, a jacket scar is had by the tiny baby. Fast asleep lies a boy with a jacket scar on his forehead. In the cupboard under the stairs, a pair of large round spectacles mended with sticky tape is put on by Harry Potter after he wakes. The stairs are crashed down by a pudgy boy. On Harry, a shadow of dust is fallen. Into the kitchen, the pudgy boy rushes. Harry comes in. At the huge pile of birthday presents, Dudley stares. Into the car with a big bag of sweets, Dudley and his mother get. His car key is wagged by Uncle Vernon in Harry's face. In the Reptile House at the zoo, the sleeping python is stared at by Dudley. On the glass, Vernon bangs. At the snake, Harry looks sympathetically. Its head is lifted by the python and it winks. Its tongue is flicked and it nods. Its head is shaken. Harry is knocked aside by Dudley. Suddenly, the glass partition is vanished. Over the rail, Dudley tumbles. Into the pond inside the snake's enclosure, he falls headfirst. Spluttering in the pond, Dudley sits, as the wooden rail is slithered over by the snake and it is down onto the floor beside Harry. Its head is raised by the python and it stares straight at him.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The owl flies low along the misty road. As it silently vanishes through the trees, an elderly gentleman emerges from the shadows. With a flowing white beard, long white hair, and a pointed black hat, he walks along the pavement and stops under a street light. Holding a small metal object, he flicks it open and points at a street lamp, absorbing the light. He extinguishes all the street lights, closes the object, and looks at a plump tabby cat, which hiccups and transforms into a stern-looking woman with a cloak and pointed hat. A bright light appears above the trees, revealing the motorcycle of Hagrid, a huge giant, who screeches to a halt. With twinkling eyes and a huge black beard, he hands over a small bundle wrapped in a warm blanket. Professor Dumbledore places the bundle on a doorstep, and Hagrid sheds a tear. The tiny baby has a distinctive scar on his forehead. In a cupboard under the stairs, Harry Potter wakes and puts on repaired round spectacles. A pudgy boy knocks dust onto Harry as he crashes down the stairs. The boy rushes to the kitchen, where Harry enters to see Dudley staring at a large pile of birthday gifts. Dudley and his mother leave in a car with sweets, while Uncle Vernon wags his car key at Harry. At the zoo's Reptile House, Dudley stares at a sleeping python as Vernon bangs on the glass. Harry looks at the snake sympathetically, and it lifts its head, winks, flicks its tongue, and nods. Dudley shoves Harry, and the glass partition disappears. Dudley falls into the pond in the snake's enclosure. He splutters in the water as the snake slithers over the rail and beside Harry, raising its head and staring directly at him.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: The owl swoops low along the misty road and silently disappears through the trees, revealing an elderly gentleman with a flowing white beard and a pointed black hat. A plump tabby cat on a wall turns its head as the gentleman stops beneath a street light, holding a small metal object. He points it at a lamp, extinguishing its light, then does the same to others. Once all lights are out, he lowers the object and looks over his glasses at the cat, which hiccups and transforms into a stern woman in a cloak and pointed hat. A motorcycle light appears in the sky, as Hagrid, a giant with a black beard, lands. He hands over a small bundle wrapped in a blanket to Professor Dumbledore, who places it on a doorstep, as a tear falls from Hagrid's cheek. The tiny baby has a scar on his forehead. Sleeping in a cupboard under the stairs, Harry Potter wakes, dons taped spectacles, as a pudgy boy crashes down the stairs, scattering dust on Harry, then rushes to the kitchen. Dudley gapes at birthday presents, then joins his mother in the car with sweets. Uncle Vernon wags car keys at Harry. At the zoo's Reptile House, Dudley watches a sleeping python. Vernon bangs on the glass; Harry sympathizes and the python winks. Dudley knocks Harry aside, the glass disappears, and Dudley falls into the snake's pond. The python slithers out, staring at Harry.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
The owl gracefully takes flight, spreading its wings wide and swooping low as it makes its way along the misty, atmospheric road. As it glides silently and smoothly away through the dense trees lining the path, an upright elderly gentleman mysteriously emerges out of the shadows. This distinguished figure boasts a flowing white beard paired with long, silky white hair cascading down, and he is adorned in a pointed black hat, adding to his enigmatic appearance. Nearby, a plump tabby cat sitting cozily on a wall turns its head with curiosity to observe the scene. 

The old gentleman proceeds to walk along the pavement with a calm demeanor and eventually stops beneath a glowing street light. In his hand, he securely holds a small metal object, which he expertly flicks open with precision. With a deliberate gesture, he raises this metal object and carefully points it at a street lamp. Instantly, the light from the lamp seems to fly towards his hand, and the lamp itself goes dark. The illumination from the second street lamp vanishes in the same manner, followed by a third. Once all the lights along the road have been extinguished, the old gentleman lowers the metal object and flicks it shut, emanating a sense of finality. 

Peering intently over the top of his half-moon glasses, he directs his gaze at the plump tabby cat. The cat gives a surprising hiccup, and its shadow looms large and imposing against the wall. Suddenly, it transforms into a stern-looking woman who is now wearing an elegant cloak and a towering, pointed black hat with an impressive large brim. In the sky above the treetops, a bright light appears, revealing the lights of an approaching motorcycle. With coattails flying in the wind, Hagrid, a massive giant of a man, zooms down and screeches to a halt in style. His twinkling eyes gleam brightly from below his dark, bushy eyebrows, complementing his enormous black beard. Gently, he hands over a small bundle wrapped securely in a warm, cozy blanket. With care, Professor Dumbledore softly places the bundle on a doorstep, and a single tear rolls down Hagrid's cheek, capturing the moment's emotion. This tiny baby, lying there, has a distinctive scar shaped like a lightning bolt on his forehead. 

Meanwhile, a boy with a similar jagged scar on his forehead lies fast asleep in his small, cramped cupboard under the stairs. At that moment, Harry Potter awakens and methodically puts on a pair of large, round spectacles that have been mended with sticky tape. Upstairs, a pudgy boy suddenly crashes down the stairs with a loud thud, and a shadowy puff of dust falls upon Harry. The pudgy boy rushes excitedly into the kitchen. Harry follows him in, where Dudley stands staring at the enormous pile of birthday presents before him. Soon after, Dudley and his mother make their way into the car, carrying a large bag filled with sweets. Uncle Vernon, with a stern expression, wags his car key in Harry's face with intention. 

Later, at the Reptile House in the zoo, Dudley stands transfixed as he gazes at the sleeping python behind the glass enclosure. Vernon, growing impatient, bangs loudly on the glass. Meanwhile, Harry looks at the snake with sympathy, understanding its plight. Remarkably, the python lifts its head and winks knowingly at Harry. It flicks its tongue and nods in acknowledgment before shaking its head in amusement. Just then, Dudley rudely knocks Harry aside. In an unexpected turn of events, the glass partition suddenly disappears. Dudley, caught off guard, tumbles over the rail and falls headfirst into the pond within the snake's enclosure. Sitting there, spluttering in disbelief, as he struggles in the pond, Dudley looks on in shock. The snake, having gained its freedom, slithers smoothly over the wooden rail and onto the floor beside Harry. With a sense of intrigue, the python raises its head and stares directly at him.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
The owl, with its elegant and graceful movements, takes to the air, spreading its wide wings as it swoops low with remarkable agility while making its journey along the misty and atmospheric road. As this magnificent creature glides away silently and smoothly through the dense trees that line the winding path, an upright and elderly gentleman, enveloped in an aura of mystery, emerges quietly out of the shadows. This distinguished figure boasts a flowing white beard, accompanied by long, silky white hair that cascades down his back, and he is adorned in a pointed black hat, which adds further to his enigmatic and mysterious appearance. Nearby, a plump tabby cat, sitting cozily and comfortably on a wall, turns its curious head to observe the unfolding scene.

The old gentleman, maintaining a calm and composed demeanor, proceeds to walk serenely along the pavement and eventually comes to a stop beneath a glowing streetlight. In his hand, he securely holds a small metal object, which he expertly flicks open with impressive precision. With a deliberate and intentional gesture, he raises this metal object and carefully points it at one of the street lamps. Instantly, the warm light emanating from the lamp seemingly flies towards his hand, and the lamp itself goes dark. The illumination from the second street lamp vanishes in the same mysterious manner, followed closely by a third. Once all the lights lining the road have been extinguished, the old gentleman lowers the metal object and flicks it shut, emanating a profound sense of finality and completion.

Peering intently over the top of his half-moon glasses, he directs his focused gaze at the plump tabby cat. The cat responds with a surprising hiccup, and its shadow looms large and imposing against the adjacent wall. In a sudden and astonishing transformation, the cat morphs into a stern-looking woman, now dressed in an elegant cloak along with a towering, pointed black hat that features an impressively large brim. In the dark sky above the treetops, a bright light appears, revealing the approaching lights of a motorcycle. With his coattails dramatically flying in the wind, Hagrid, a massive giant of a man, zooms down from above and screeches to a halt with remarkable style. His twinkling eyes gleam brightly from beneath his dark and bushy eyebrows, complementing his enormous black beard. Gently and with care, he hands over a small bundle wrapped securely in a warm and cozy blanket. With tenderness, Professor Dumbledore softly places the bundle on a doorstep, and a single tear rolls down Hagrid's cheek, capturing the deep emotion of the moment. This tiny baby, lying there, bears a distinctive scar shaped like a lightning bolt on his forehead.

Meanwhile, a boy, who shares a similar jagged scar on his forehead, lies fast asleep in his small and cramped cupboard under the stairs. At that very moment, Harry Potter awakens and methodically puts on his pair of large, round spectacles, which have been mended with sticky tape. Upstairs, a pudgy boy suddenly crashes down the stairs with a loud and resounding thud, causing a shadowy puff of dust to fall down upon Harry. The pudgy boy rushes excitedly into the kitchen. Harry follows him in, where Dudley stands wide-eyed, staring in amazement at the enormous pile of birthday presents arranged before him. Soon after, Dudley and his mother make their way into the car, carrying a large bag filled with a selection of sweets. Uncle Vernon, with a stern and disapproving expression, wags his car key emphatically in Harry's face.

Later, at the Reptile House in the zoo, Dudley stands transfixed as he gazes with fascination at the sleeping python behind the glass enclosure. Vernon, growing increasingly impatient, bangs loudly and insistently on the glass. Meanwhile, Harry looks at the snake with sympathy, understanding its plight and predicament. Remarkably, the python lifts its head and winks knowingly at Harry. It flicks its tongue and nods in acknowledgment and then shakes its head in amusement. Just then, Dudley rudely knocks Harry aside. In a completely unexpected turn of events, the glass partition suddenly disappears altogether. Dudley, caught off guard by this sudden disappearance, tumbles over the rail and falls headfirst into the pond within the snake's enclosure. Sitting there, spluttering in disbelief, as he struggles within the water of the pond, Dudley looks on in a state of shock. The snake, now having gained its freedom, slithers smoothly and elegantly over the wooden rail and onto the floor by Harry's side. With a sense of intrigue and interest, the python raises its head and directs its gaze directly at him.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: The owl unfurls its wings with a gentle rustle and begins to soar, maneuvering with grace through the misty air, skimming just above the surface of the road. Its silent flight takes it smoothly away into the dense canopy of trees, disappearing from sight. From the depths of shadow, an elderly gentleman materializes with a dignified presence. His appearance is striking, with a long, flowing white beard and matching silky white hair, topped by a black hat with a pronounced point. Meanwhile, a well-fed tabby cat perched on a nearby wall becomes intrigued, its head swiveling to follow the old man's movement. The gentleman proceeds with measured steps along the pavement, halting deliberately under the glow of a street light. In his grasp is a small metal object; he flicks it open with practiced finesse. With a precise motion, he aims the object at the street lamp, and with an unseen force, the lamp's light seems to be drawn towards the old man, plunging the lamp into darkness. The light from another lamp follows suit, then a third, until the roadway is shrouded in shadows. Satisfied, he lowers the metal object and snaps it shut with a decisive click. Peering over his half-moon spectacles, he regards the tabby cat. The cat suddenly hiccups, and its shadow stretches and shifts until it transforms into a stern woman cloaked in mystery, adorned in a sweeping cloak and a broad-brimmed, pointed hat. Above the trees, a brilliant light emerges, revealing the headlights of an approaching motorcycle. With his coattails billowing behind him, Hagrid, a giant in stature, descends with speed and skill, bringing the motorcycle to a screeching stop. His eyes, twinkling with life, gaze out from beneath dark, bushy eyebrows, and a great black beard frames his face. From his massive hands, he carefully transfers a small, warmly wrapped bundle. Professor Dumbledore accepts it with gentle care, placing the bundle tenderly on a doorstep as a tear spills down Hagrid's cheek. Inside the bundle, a tiny baby rests peacefully, a distinct lightning-bolt-shaped scar visible on his forehead. As years later, the same boy lies fast asleep beneath the stairs, Harry Potter awakens and reaches for his oversized round spectacles, held together with sticky tape. Above him, the thundering descent of a pudgy boy dashes down the stairs, sending a shower of dust upon Harry. The boy charges ahead into the kitchen, and Harry follows. In the kitchen, Dudley gazes eagerly at a towering stack of birthday presents. Dudley, accompanied by his mother, clambers into the car, carrying a large bag of sweets. Uncle Vernon brandishes his car keys tauntingly in Harry's direction. At the zoo's Reptile House, Dudley intently watches a motionless python, prompting Vernon to rap sharply on the glass. Harry sympathizes with the snake, which responds by lifting its head and giving him a knowing wink. It further acknowledges him with a flick of its tongue and a series of nods and head shakes. A sudden push from Dudley sends Harry sprawling aside. In an unexpected twist, the glass partition vanishes, and Dudley loses his balance, careening over the railing and plummeting headfirst into the shallow pond within the snake's enclosure. As water splashes around Dudley's sputtering form, the snake itself glides smoothly over the wooden rail, slithering onto the floor beside Harry, before pausing to raise its head and fix its gaze directly on him.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: The owl silently swoops along the misty road and vanishes through the trees, as an elderly gentleman with a flowing white beard and long, silky hair emerges from the shadows, wearing a pointed black hat. A curious plump tabby cat on a wall watches as the gentleman walks to a street light, flicks open a small metal object, and extinguishes all the street lamps by directing their light into his hand. Lowering the object, he glances over his half-moon glasses at the cat, which transforms into a stern-looking woman in a cloak and pointed hat. A bright light appears above the treetops, revealing a giant, Hagrid, arriving on a motorcycle. He hands over a small bundle to Professor Dumbledore, who places it gently on a doorstep, as a tear slips down Hagrid's cheek. The bundle contains a sleeping baby with a jacket scar on his forehead. In a cupboard under the stairs, Harry Potter wakes, putting on spectacles mended with sticky tape, as a pudgy boy thunders down the stairs, sending dust over Harry before rushing to the kitchen. There, Dudley marvels at his pile of birthday presents before he and his mother drive off with sweets. Uncle Vernon taunts Harry with car keys. At the zoo's Reptile House, Dudley gawks at a sleeping python, while Vernon bangs on the glass. Harry sympathizes with the snake, which acknowledges him with a wink and a nod. When Dudley pushes Harry aside, the glass partition suddenly vanishes, causing Dudley to fall into the pond inside the enclosure. As Dudley splutters in the water, the snake slithers out, raising its head to meet Harry's gaze.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The owl takes wing and swoops low along the misty road, the same road often whispered about in local legends for its eerie atmosphere. As it glides silently away through the trees, an upright elderly gentleman appears out of the shadows, resembling a character from a magical tale. He has a flowing white beard and long, silky white hair, and wears a pointed black hat reminiscent of old wizard folklore. A plump tabby cat sitting on a stone wall, a spot favored by local cats for sunbathing, turns its head curiously. The old gentleman walks along the pavement and stops beneath a street light, one of the few remaining gas lamps in the area that gives off a warm, nostalgic glow. In his hand, he holds a small metal object, a Deluminator invented by famed wizard Albus Dumbledore, which he flicks open. He raises the metal object and points it at a street lamp. The light from the lamp flies towards his hand and the lamp goes out, reflecting his mastery of magical devices. The light from the second street lamp disappears, and then a third, as if performing a silent symphony of darkness. When all the lights in the road have been extinguished, the old gentleman lowers the metal object and flicks it shut, a practiced motion from years of use. He looks over the top of his half-moon glasses at the plump tabby cat. The cat gives a hiccup, and its shadow looms large against the wall, an illusion common in tales of transformation. It turns into a stern-looking woman, Professor McGonagall, wearing a cloak and a tall pointed black hat with a large brim, a symbol of her authority within the magical community. A bright light appears in the sky above the treetops, the unmistakable lights of a motorcycle known as the enchanted vehicle belonging to Hagrid. Coattails flying, Hagrid, a huge giant and Keeper of Keys and Grounds at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, zooms down and screeches to a halt. Twinkling eyes peer out below dark bushy eyebrows that frequently give him a kindly, if somewhat intimidating, appearance. He has a huge black beard, often the subject of admiration among his friends. He hands over a small bundle wrapped in a warm blanket, containing Harry Potter, the boy who survived an infamous attack by the dark wizard Voldemort. As Professor Dumbledore gently places the bundle on a doorstep belonging to the Dursley family, a tear runs down Hagrid's cheek, feeling the weight of leaving Harry in questionable care. The tiny baby has a jacket scar on his forehead, a lightning-bolt mark known famously throughout the wizarding world. A boy with a jacket scar on his forehead lies fast asleep, his dreams untroubled by the world he would soon re-enter. In the cupboard under the stairs, the less-than-ideal bedroom for him, Harry Potter wakes and puts on a pair of large round spectacles mended with sticky tape, a testament to his neglected upbringing. A pudgy boy, Dudley Dursley, crashes down the stairs, his spoiled nature evident in his every step. A shadow of dust falls on Harry. The pudgy boy rushes into the kitchen, eager for his indulgent breakfast. Harry comes in. Dudley stares at the huge pile of birthday presents, each one specifically requested from a list he meticulously compiled. Dudley and his mother get into the car with a big bag of sweets, their routine trip to spoil Dudley further. Uncle Vernon wags his car key in Harry's face, a reminder of his lack of freedom. In the Reptile House at the zoo, Dudley stares at the sleeping python, fascinated by the idea of anything that might seem threatening. Vernon bangs on the glass, indifferent to the stress it might cause the animals. Harry looks at the snake sympathetically, sensing an unspoken kinship. The python lifts its head and winks, a gesture rarely observed by visitors. It flicks its tongue and nods, appearing almost to communicate. It shakes its head, an expression of shared frustration. Dudley knocks Harry aside, showing little regard for anyone but himself. Suddenly, the glass partition disappears, a result of Harry's unexpected burst of magic. Dudley tumbles over the rail, helpless in the face of his own actions. He falls headfirst into the pond inside the snake's enclosure, a comeuppance for his earlier behavior. Dudley sits spluttering in the pond, soaking and bewildered, as the snake slithers over the wooden rail and down onto the floor beside Harry, its escape unnoticed by the distracted crowd. The python raises its head and stares straight at him, acknowledging the bond formed in their brief interaction.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: The owl takes wing and swoops low along the misty road. As it glides silently away through the trees an upright elderly gentleman appears out of the shadows. He has a flowing white beard and long silky white hair and wears a pointed black hat. A plump tabby cat sitting on a wall turns its head curiously. The old gentleman walks along the pavement and stops beneath a street light. In his hand he holds a small metal object which he flicks open. He raises the metal object and points it at a street lamp. The light from the lamp flies towards his hand and the lamp goes out. The light from the second street lamp disappears and then a third. When all the lights in the road have been extinguished the old gentleman lowers the metal object and flicks it shut. He looks over the top of his halfmoon glasses at the plump tabby cat. The cat gives a hiccup and its shadow looms large against the wall. It turns into a sternlooking woman wearing a cloak and a tall pointed black hat with a large brim. A bright light appears in the sky above the treetops. the lights of a motorcycle. Coattails flying. Hagrid a huge giant zooms down and screeches to a halt. Twinkling eyes peer out below dark bushy eyebrows. He has a huge black beard. He hands over a small bundle wrapped in a warm blanket. As Professor Dumbledore gently places the bundle on a doorstep a tear runs down Hagrid's cheek. The tiny baby has a jacket scar on his forehead. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. A boy with a jacket scar on his forehead lies fast asleep. In the cupboard under the stairs. Harry Potter wakes and puts on a pair of large round spectacles mended with sticky tape. A pudgy boy crashes down the stairs. A shadow of dust falls on Harry. The pudgy boy rushes into the kitchen. Harry comes in. Dudley stares at the huge pile of birthday presents. Dudley and his mother get into the car with a big bag of sweets. Uncle Vernon wags his car key in Harry's face. In the Reptile House at the zoo Dudley stares at the sleeping python. Vernon bangs on the glass. Harry looks at the snake sympathetically. The python lifts its head and winks. It flicks its tongue and nods. It shakes its head. Dudley knocks Harry aside. Suddenly the glass partition disappears. Dudley tumbles over the rail. He falls headfirst into the pond inside the snake's enclosure. Dudley sits spluttering in the pond as the snake slithers over the wooden rail and down onto the floor beside Harry. The python raises its head and stares straight at him.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: The owl takes wing and swoops low along the misty road. As it glides silently away through the trees an upright elderly gentleman appears out of the shadows. He has a flowing white beard and long silky white hair and wears a pointed black hat. A plump tabby cat sitting on a wall turns its head curiously. The old gentleman walks along the pavement and stops beneath a street light. In his hand he holds a small metal object which he flicks open. He raises the metal object and points it at a street lamp. The light from the lamp flies towards his hand and the lamp goes out. The light from the second street lamp disappears and then a third. When all the lights in the road have been extinguished the old gentleman lowers the metal object and flicks it shut. He looks over the top of his halfmoon glasses at the plump tabby cat. The cat gives a hiccup and its shadow looms large against the wall. It turns into a sternlooking woman wearing a cloak and a tall pointed black hat with a large brim. A bright light appears in the sky above the treetops. the lights of a motorcycle. Coattails flying. Hagrid a huge giant zooms down and screeches to a halt. Twinkling eyes peer out below dark bushy eyebrows. He has a huge black beard. He hands over a small bundle wrapped in a warm blanket. As Professor Dumbledore gently places the bundle on a doorstep a tear runs down Hagrid's cheek. The tiny baby has a jacket scar on his forehead. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The penguin flaps a fin and waddles high along the sandy shore. As it stumbles loudly away past the bushes, a crouched young lady jumps out of the fog. She has a short green beard and cropped, fuzzy blue hair, and wears a round purple helmet. A skinny raccoon lounging on a fence tilts its ear warily. The young lady skips along the footpath and twirls beneath a traffic sign. In her beak, she munches a large rubber ball which she tosses up. She lowers the rubber ball and hurls it at a traffic cone. The glow from the cone skates towards her beak and the cone zips away. The glow from the nearby traffic cone scurries off, and then another follows. When all the glows in the shore have been bewildered, the young lady drops the rubber ball and munches it closed. She glares over the rim of her triangular goggles at the skinny raccoon. The raccoon gives a sneeze, and its shape shrinks tiny against the fence. It warps into a nervous-looking gentleman wearing a jacket and a short round blue helmet with a tiny brim. A dim glow falls from the swamp beneath the mountain peaks, the glimmers of a skateboard. Sneakers bouncing, Blarf, a tiny elf, rolls up and skids to a dive. Swirling fingers blink out above fluffy wide shoulders. He has a tiny green mustache. He rolls over a gigantic pillow draped in a chilly shawl. As Sister Mary loudly drops the pillow on a windowsill, a spark trickles down Blarf's elbow. The huge panda has a mitten scratch on its back. A girl with a mitten scratch on her back crouches wide awake. In the trunk below the attic, Sally Ride dozes and stumbles on a set of tiny square flip-flops broken with glitter. A lanky girl bounces up the attic. A cloud of feathers tickles Sally. The lanky girl slides into the den. Sally sneaks out. Rufus peers at the small stack of holiday marbles. Rufus and his uncle slip onto the bus with a small box of chocolates. Grandma Lydia waves her bus pass near Sally's elbow. In the Aviary Chamber at the fair, Rufus peers at the fluttering parrot. Lydia scratches at the net. Sally nudges the bird reluctantly. The parrot shakes its beak and grins. It wiggles its tail and nods. It shrugs its feathers. Rufus pushes Sally backward. Quickly, the net curtain appears. Rufus jumps across the fence. He twirls sideways into the stream inside the bird's aviary. Rufus kneels laughing in the stream, as the bird flaps across the metal fence and up onto the roof around Sally. The parrot shakes its beak and gleams right at her.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: An owl swoops down a misty road, passing an elderly gentleman with a white beard and black hat. A curious tabby cat watches as the gentleman extinguishes street lamps with a metal object. The cat transforms into a stern woman with a cloak and pointed hat. A bright light reveals Hagrid, a giant, arriving on a motorcycle. He gives Professor Dumbledore a small bundle, a baby with a scar on his forehead, which Dumbledore places on a doorstep. Years later, Harry Potter, a boy with a similar scar, awakes from a cupboard under the stairs. As his cousin Dudley celebrates his birthday, Harry and the family visit the zoo. There, Dudley knocks Harry aside at the Reptile House, causing the glass partition to vanish and Dudley to fall into the snake enclosure's pond. The snake escapes, acknowledging Harry sympathetically.
